lesson.title: Create a new WPF project using Visual Studio
lesson.description: Create a new Couchbase Lite project for WPF in Visual Studio

introduction.paragraph: This lesson describes how to set up the Couchbase Lite environment for WPF using Visual Studio.

body.paragraph: Before you can build an app, you need to set up your development environment:

list-item.paragraph: Download and install Visual Studio. The Visual Studio installer will install everything you need to develop Windows apps.
In the Start Page choose New Project.
In the New Project window, select Visual C# > Windows Desktop > WPF Application, enter Couchbase Events for the application name and click OK:

body.paragraph: To use Couchbase-Lite in your WPF application, you need to add the Couchbase Lite package from NuGet. You can do this using the built-in NuGet support in Visual Studio.

list-item.paragraph: Right-click the CouchbaseEvents project in the Solution Explorer and select Manage NuGet Packages to open the NuGet Package dialog.
Search for Couchbase Lite, select it from the list, and click Install to add Couchbase Lite along with its dependencies to the project.

body.paragraph: Running the empty app at this point verifies everying is set up correctly.
